title: How to Make an Origami Balloon

steps.headline: Fold a square piece of paper diagonally, in both directions.
steps.description: The creases should make an "X" in the paper. Feel free to add a design to the paper so it appears once it is folded.

steps.headline: Fold the paper in half.
steps.description: Do this by bringing the bottom portion of the paper to meet the top portion of the paper.

steps.headline: Bring the upper right corner in as shown.
steps.description: Then, repeat this on the other side. Press down firmly on the folds.

steps.headline: Fold the flaps to the top.
steps.description: Then, flip the whole thing over and repeat the same steps on the other side to make a diamond shape.

parts.name: Tucking the Flaps into the Folds

steps.headline: Fold the right and left corners into the center of the diamond.
steps.description: Repeat this on the other side.

steps.headline: Tuck the loose flaps into the folds you just made.
steps.description: Do this by folding a small triangle on each of the flaps and then tucking them into the folds. Repeat this for all four flaps. If you have a hard time tucking the flaps into the folds, use tape to secure them to the folds. You can also use a pencil to open the folds easily and to avoid damaging the flaps.

steps.headline: Turn the folded paper to the end that does not have any flaps.
steps.description: Locate the hole in the center of this side.

steps.headline: Blow into the hole.
steps.description: The ball should inflate - just remember to keep those flaps tucked in. You might also need to loosen up the other folds a little bit for the ball to become round. To make a water balloon, slowly fill the balloon with water via the small hole.

Repeat this for all four flaps. If you have a hard time tucking the flaps into the folds, use tape to secure them to the folds. To make a water balloon, slowly fill the balloon with water via the small hole.
